do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does: I cherish TW because I can tweak (I cannot programm but I can tweak.) it to my needs or use as is just fine. It allows me to own my data. With Syncthing on my pc and my android mobile (with SDcard) I do not need cloud services. With TW being text based I can use my stuff forever.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I have written custom CSS styles
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki with TiddlyDesktop;Single-file wiki third-party mobile app (e.g. Tiddloid, Quine)
as you selected diy, would be grateful f: With Syncthing on my pc and my android mobile (with SDcard). I don't want cloud services for my personal stuff.

outside of plugins, palettes and other i:
I usually start with some of the great customisations out there. I recently tweaked 3 of them. Mostly because I prefer my sidebar on the right: https://tiddlyhost.com/explore/user/Xrizzy.
I do mostly stylesheets and I tweak plugins but keep my hands off the core.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin:
* Keepin TiddlyWiki alive and keep making it better all while my stuff will still be readable
* Very helpful community
* Good documentation
* Making TW more and more capable to run well on multi languages
I am excited for TW because more and more people want to own their data and use and participate in an open source project.
what could we do better? prompts for thi: Since 2003 I keep coming back to TW. Every now and then I get a little lost in tweaking TW and then I don't use it for a while. I guess I could contribute more where Design, HTML, CSS is needed. Yet I want to learn and dive deeper into TW. I still struggle with GIT and Node. If I had one wish right now I would like to be able to put the sidebar left or right and the main buttons top or buttom on mobile and left or right on the desktop. Multi-user capability is probably asking too much. :)
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
